Q1: Who was Frederick I, Count Palatine of Simmern?
A1: Frederick I was the Count Palatine of Simmern from 1459 until 1480.

Q2: When was Frederick born?
A2: Frederick was born in 1417.

Q3: Who were Frederick's parents?
A3: Frederick's parents were Stephen, Count Palatine of Simmern-Zweibrücken, and his wife, Anna of Veldenz.

Q4: How many children did Frederick have with his wife Margaret?
A4: Frederick had eight children with his wife Margaret, including five sons and three daughters.

Q5: What were the names of Frederick's sons?
A5: Frederick's sons were Stephen, born in 1457; John I, born in 1459; Frederick, born in 1460; Rupert, born in 1461; and William, born in 1468.

Q6: What were the names of Frederick's daughters?
A6: Frederick's daughters were Katherine, born in 1455; Anne, born in 1465; and Margaret, born in 1466.

Q7: Where was Frederick buried?
A7: Frederick was buried in the Augustinian Abbey of Ravengiersburg.

A1: Reichard was the Count Palatine of Simmern-Sponheim from 1569 until 1598.

Q2: When was Reichard born?
A2: Reichard was born in Simmern in 1521.

Q3: Who were Reichard's parents?
A3: Reichard was born to Johann II, Count Palatine of Simmern.

Q4: How many children did Reichard have with his first wife Juliane of Wied?
A4: Reichard had four children with his first wife Juliane of Wied: Juliana, Katherine, an unnamed son in 1574, and another unnamed son in 1575.

Q5: Who was Reichard's second wife?
A5: Reichard married Emilie of Württemberg on 26 March 1578.

Q6: How many children did Reichard have with his second wife?
A6: Reichard had no children with his second wife Emilie of Württemberg.

Q7: Who was Reichard's third wife?
A7: Reichard married Anne Margaret of Palatinate-Veldenz on 14 December 1589.

Q8: How many children did Reichard have with his third wife?
A8: Reichard had no children with his third wife Anne Margaret of Palatinate-Veldenz.

Q9: When did Reichard die?
A9: Reichard died in Simmern in 1598.

Q10: Who inherited Simmern-Sponheim after Reichard's death?
A10: After Reichard's death, his great-nephew Frederick IV inherited Simmern-Sponheim.

Q1: Who was Stephen of Simmern-Zweibrücken?
A1: Stephen of Simmern-Zweibrücken was a Count Palatine of Simmern and Zweibrücken from 1410 until his death in 1459.

Q2: What was the name of Stephen's father?
A2: Stephen's father was King Rupert of Germany.

Q3: Who did Stephen marry?
A3: Stephen married Anna of Veldenz in 1410.

Q4: How many children did Stephen and Anna have?
A4: Stephen and Anna had five children: Anne, Margaret, Frederick I, Rupert, and Louis I.

Q5: What happened to Anna after her father's death in 1444?
A5: After Anna's father died in 1444, she inherited the Veldenz share of Sponheim.

Q6: How did Stephen divide his country between his sons in 1448?
A6: In 1448, Stephen divided his country between his two younger brothers, Frederick I and Louis I.

Q7: Where was Stephen buried?
A7: Stephen was buried in the Schlosskirche (German: palace church), formerly the church of the Knights Hospitallers in Meisenheim.

Q8: How many sons did Stephen have with Anna?
A8: Stephen and Anna had six sons: Anne, Margaret, Frederick I, Rupert, Louis I, and Stephen.

Q9: What was the name of the church where Stephen was buried?
A9: The church where Stephen was buried is called the Schlosskirche (German: palace church).

Q10: How many years did Stephen live after his father's death in 1410?
A10: Stephen lived for 48 years after his father's death in 1410.

Q1: Who was John Christian, Count Palatine of Sulzbach?
A1: John Christian was the Count Palatine of Sulzbach from 1732-1733.

A2: John Christian's father was Duke Theodore Eustace, Count Palatine of Sulzbach.

Q3: Who did John Christian marry twice?
A3: John Christian married Marie Anne Henriëtte Leopoldine de La Tour d'Auvergne and Eleonore Philippina Christina Sophia of Hesse-Rotenburg.

Q4: How many children did John Christian have with his first wife?
A4: John Christian had two children with his first wife, Marie Anne Henriëtte Leopoldine de La Tour d'Auvergne: Charles Theodore and Maria Anne.

Q5: What happened to John Christian's elder brother Joseph Charles?
A5: John Christian's elder brother Joseph Charles died before him.

Q6: Who was the Elector Palatine before John Christian?
A6: Before John Christian, Charles III Philip was the Elector Palatine.

Q7: How many children did John Christian have with his second wife?
A7: John Christian had no children with his second wife, Eleonore Philippina Christina Sophia of Hesse-Rotenburg.

Q8: When did John Christian die?
A8: John Christian died on July 20, 1733, in Sulzbach.

Q9: What was the name of the line of Wittelsbach that John Christian belonged to?
A9: John Christian belonged to the Palatine Neuburg line of Wittelsbach.

Q10: How many brothers did John Christian have?
A10: John Christian had one elder brother, Joseph Charles, who died before him.
